A suiteble dressing of calcium carbonate will be applied every 6 years before the Test Barley crop.
(a) 1st dressing of N, and N, in spring. Repeated dressings of N, and N, at the dane rafes after the 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th otc.outs (lot thellast).
(v) 41st dressing of N, and N, in spring. A second dressing at the se rates laler in The swmer (in third year after hay is cut).
(c) N as sulphate of ammonia to Potatoes only.
The basal dressing is applied as a Granulated Compound containing 13% P.O, 13% KO.
275 2
Sheep Grazing Technique. This has been modified since the experiment started, the present scheme being as follows:
The grazing unit is a half plot of about 1/25 acre. This is presented to the sheep as two or more folds, the team being of such a size that it will greze a single fold to about the level of the sample cut (2") in one day. The intention is to provide fresh untainted grazing every day, leaving the grazed area as a run backs To equalize conditions between the folds within one sub plot, the order of grazing the folds is reversed at every cycle, i.e, the fold which was grazed first on one cycle is grazed last on the next.
Quarter plot area: 0.0220 acre.

60/B/2.1 LEY AND ARABLE ROTATIONS
Highfield and Fosters Field 1960 - the 12th year.
For details of treatments, rotations, etc. see "Details of the Classical and Long Term Experiments" 1956.
Second yeer lucerne: Three applications of sodium molybdate were mede as a foliar spray to small areas before each cut, These areas were harvested separately.
Rate of application: 4 oz of sodium molybdate in 700 gellons per acre, applied to same area for each cut.
In 1960 yields of areble hay, cut grass and silage were estimated (except where otherwise stated in "Cultivations, etc.") from samples cut by a flail action forage harvesters Two sample strips 40" wide were cut from each sub-plot.

65/B/1.1 IEY AND ARABIE ROTATIONS (HIA and FIA) ”
Highfield and Fosters Field 196, the 17th year.
For details of treatments, rotations etc., see 'Details' and ‘Results’ 63/B/1.1 and 64/B/1.1.
Winter wheat: A further test of 0 v 0.6 N (T0 v T1) is now applied as 'Nitro-Chalk' in December or early Janwery. The 1965 crop received additional K20 at 0.6 cwt on the plough furrow, as muriate of potash.
Potatoes: All fertiliser tests on potatoes are discontinued, except the comparison of dung and PK (0.5 cwt P205, 1.0 owt K20 as (0:14:28)) on Quarter plots. The basal compound is now (15:15:15) applied at 1.2 cwt N, 1.2 owt P205 and 1.2 cwt K20.
Sugar beet: The N test is discontinued. The basal nitrogen is 1.5 cwt N, partly epplied in the besal compound (now 15:15:15) and partly as 'Nitro-Chalk'.
Hy: This is no longer undersown. Italian ryegrass is sown in autum or spring. The menuring remains the same but the basal NPK is applied in the seedbed (for spring sowing) or in early spring (for autum sowing).
Lucerne: An infestation with stem eelvorm (Ditylenchus dipsaci) made it necessary to plough out one whole plot of third year lucerne an each field.
NOrES: (1) The wheat following ryegrass (replacing 3rd year 'all-grass' ley) on Fosters wes badly thinned in spring by stem-boring larvae.
(2) Weather prevented the last cutting planned for lst and 2nd year all-grass and clover-grass leys, also permanent and reseeded grasses. g Cultivations, etc.: HIGEFIELD .

Winter wheat: Sulphate of armonie is now used for the sutum N test. The basal PK is now epplied at 0,45 cwt P205 and 0.90 cwt K20 ploughed in and 0.45 cwt P205 and 0.90 cwt K20 broadcest before sowing (all as (0:14:28)).
All-grass leys and clover-grass leys (2nd and 3rd years), and ell-grass and clover-grass permanent end reseeded grass plots: Fertiliser is now applied to these plots in spring before cutting as follows:i= All-gress sub plots and ell-grass leys: 0,6 cwt N end 0.6 cwt
K20 as (1630116). Clover-grass sud plots and clover-grass leys: 0,6 cwt K20 as mriate of potash,
Potatoes: Fertilisers are pow as followsi-
Swh-plots with dung: 1.2 cwt N, 1,8 cwt P205, 1.8 cwt ¥20 broadcast before ridging es 15:15:15 plus 0:20:20,
Sub-plots without dung: 1.5 ewt N, 2.5 owt P205, 2.5 cwt K20 broedcest before ridging as 15:15:15 plus 03:20:20,
Former reseeded gress plots ploughed up for wheat 1963, 1964, 1965: These are now put through the arable sequence of treatment crops and were sown with ryegress in spring 1966 on the plots which carried the barley test crop. in 1965. These hay plots receive the same manurial treatment as those in the permanent erable sequence (but in 1966 the former were sown in spring, the latter in autum).
Reseeded grass plots: Further ploughing up of these plots is discontinued,

T1/R/RN/1 and TL/R/RN/2 LEY/ARABLE
Object: To study the effects of three-year leys on the fertility of the soil as measured by & sequence of three arable test crops. Since 1968, continuous winter wheat has been grown after the three test crops to study the build-up end decline of take-all (Ophiocbolus greminis) after the different cropping sequences = Highfield and Fosters,
The 23rd year, old gress, leys, barley, wheat,

T8/R/RN/1 and 78/R/RN/2
From 1963 (reseeded) and 1968 (old grass) some grass plots were ploughed and cropped with the same test crops as above, thereafter these plots followed the ARABLE rotation. In 1973 some of these plots were returned to reseeded grass.
From 1968 only two phases on each field continued in the original six-course rotation (the museum blocks). The four other phases (the new sequence blocks) were sown to wheat every year at the end of the test-crop cycle.
In both 1977 and 1978 one phase, fallowed in the previous year started a new sequence of treatment cropping. In 1978 one of the remaining phases was fallowed and the other remained in wheat (no yields). The new sequences will be introduced progressively on these remaining phases. The new sequences are:
SEQUENCE Treatment crops Test crops
LUCERNE (previously LUCERNE) * LU, LU, LU W, W, W, W
CLOGRA (previously CLOGRA) LC, LC, LC W, W, W, W
GRASS/G (previously GRASS) R, R, R W, W, W, W
ARABLE/A (previously ARABLE) 0, P, BE W, W, W, W
ARABLE/R (previously RESEEDED) B, B, W VW, W, W, W
GRASS/0G . (previously OLDGRASS) R, R, R W, W, W, W R= ryegrass, BE = beans. Other symbols as above. All ploughed at the end of the treatment crop cycle except GRASS/OG = direct drilled to wheat. Treatment crop cycles start after nine previous cereals followed by one fallow. In treatment years yields are taken only from barley and wheat.
